channel.title: Tim Videos Planet - Developers news - Tag: RUBY
channel.description: News from our best developers, all news aggregated by planet.

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
[GSoC Snippet] 08/07/2014
item.description:
[code] added filters mockup based on labels, now it is possible to create new filters only by adding new keyword to _config.yml (issues: special_filters)
[code] changed hierarchy of rss configuration in _config.yml to make all settings consistent
[code] added details to every issue (below body of issue)

Now I will create working search/filter engine in JavaScript based on that filters that will work without any further work in future in case of new filters.
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
[GSoC Snippet] 07/07/2014
item.description:
[code] added basic search/filter engine working only for author, title, body and assignee fields in issues on Planet
[code] changed javascripts folder structure: plugins moved to /js/plugins directory and all custom JavasScripts are in /js directory. I've also changed variable name styles of some variables in own written JavaScritps from lowercase_separated_by_underscores to camelCase

Plans for tomorrow:
[code] add filters based on labels (Project, Skill, Level, Type, Language). I will create solution that is generic and will work also for new filters added after development
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
[GSoC Snippet] 06/07/2014
item.description:
[code] added second issues filter mockup in Planet
[code] added input autocomplete (twitter typeahead.js) to fields: author, assignee and title to make search easier
[code] small CSS fixes

Plans for next days:
[code] add first javascript search engine for issues
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
[GSoC Snippet] 04/07/2014
item.description:
Today I talked with Tim about deployment of getting-started page, we've created document with steps of deployment and we will continue tomorrow.

I also found some great posts about organizing work with GitHub Issues: http://www.ianbicking.org/blog/2014/03/use-github-issues-to-organize-a-project.html and http://wiredcraft.com/posts/2014/01/08/how-we-write-our-github-issues.html. Great post how to keep well organization of projects and issues and make sure that every feature is created incremental.

I also found great application to manage Issues and assignment and status (to make Issues more like Trello or Kanban table): https://waffle.io/ and http://octokan.com, I've tested them, and I very like waffle.io, because of nice and easy interface, it can be used by everyone in organization to track progress of projects and it is free of charge!

[code] added labels to issues website on Planet
[code] added issue content to issues website on Planet (currently they are not generated from markdown, I will fix it tomorrow)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
pinoss pushed to master at pinoss/supybot-configuration
[GSoC Snippet] 02/07/2014 and 03/07/2014
item.description:
Last few days I've had some problems with Internet connection, because I am currently in Croatia for 2 weeks. But finally I bought safe and quite fast Internet here and started to work again. Because I had poor Internet connection I wasn't able even to commit and connect to SSH (because of timeout error), but now it seems to work good.

[code] I've started working on issues, did some research and read about it, and created new page on planet with issues to start working on it (currently it has contains only list with issues, but soon I will add more features to that).

[code] I've created new configuration for supybot to notificate new planet news on IRC. I think all is ready to be deployed on our server, but I need to talk with Tim how to add that supybot to server (run manually or with crontab, or as a deamon, to make sure that will always work).

Next days I will spend working on issues, adding new functionalities, etc.
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at pinoss/supybot-configuration
pinoss created repository pinoss/supybot-configuration
pinoss created branch master at pinoss/supybot-configuration
[GSoC Snippet] 29/06/2014
item.description:
[configuration] finally I figured out how Supybot should be configured and I have basic configuration (https://github.com/pinoss/supybot-configuration). Supybot checks for changes in RSS for every 15 minutes and sends a message to irc channel. I've used and tested it on my test chanel on freenode, tomorrow I will add that bot to our server to run on actually used channel.

Finally I've passed all my exams and now I will have more time for work. :)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 27/08/2014
item.description:
[configuration] supybot configuration to add RSS feed to our IRC: Today I was fighting (for few hours) with Supybot configuration. Actually, thanks to supybot-wizard, configuration is really easy, but in documentation there are no examples of correct configuration and some custom options are really hard to be set. So I still don't have working configuration, but I think I am will do that tomorrow. :+1:
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer
